intro: Gouania glandulosa var. sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis gouania, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
